original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed cing ji ltar gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed cing ji ltar gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination of the intrinsic reality of all things, and the discrimination of how they are imagined to be, such as form.

original: gnyis pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa ste /üîΩgzugs la sogs bar ming btags pa'i dngos po de nyid la 'di ni bstan du yod do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa ste / gzugs la sogs bar ming btags pa'i dngos po de nyid la 'di ni bstan du yod do //
translated: The second is the discrimination of particulars.

original: 'di ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination of the things designated by names such as form, such as this is demonstrable, this is indemonstrable, and so on.

original: gsum pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The third is the discrimination of the apprehension of wholes.

original: gzugs la sogs par ming du btags ba'i dngos po de nyid la bdag dang / sems can dang / khyim dang / dmag dang / nags la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //üîΩbzhi pa ni bdag go snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par ming du btags ba'i dngos po de nyid la bdag dang / sems can dang / khyim dang / dmag dang / nags la sogs par 'dzin pa'o // bzhi pa ni bdag go snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of things designated by names such as form as a self, a sentient being, a household, an army, a forest, and so on.üîΩThe fourth is the discrimination thinking I.

original: lnga pa ni bdag gi'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bdag gi'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The fifth is the discrimination thinking mine.

original: dngos po gang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The first is the conception of the self and what is mine with regard to things that are perishable and subject to appropriation.

original: drug pa ni sdug par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni sdug par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the conception of the pleasant.

original: bdun pa ni sdug pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩbrgyad pa ni gnyi @129a * //
analyzed: bdun pa ni sdug pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'o // brgyad pa ni gnyi @129a * //
translated: The seventh is the conception of the unpleasant.

original: ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the conception of the opposite of both.

original: go rims bzhin du mdzes pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mdzes pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: These are the conceptions that arise from the pleasant, the unpleasant, and the opposite of both, respectively.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang na ri rnam par rtog pa brgyad po de dag thams cad kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa skye ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang na ri rnam par rtog pa brgyad po de dag thams cad kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa skye ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The master Hƒ´nayƒÅna says that all eight of these conceptions are unobscured and neutral, and have the nature of wisdom that produces maturation.

original: yang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, they have the nature of conception and discernment.

original: dngos po gsum bskyed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang po gsum gyis ni rnam par rtog pa spros pa'i gnas dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po dbang po drug dang yul drug po dag skyed pa'i byed do //
analyzed: dngos po gsum bskyed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang po gsum gyis ni rnam par rtog pa spros pa'i gnas dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po dbang po drug dang yul drug po dag skyed pa'i byed do //
translated: The three things that are generated are as follows: The first three conceptualizations generate the conceptualization that is the basis of mental proliferation and the things that are the objects of the six sense faculties and the six sense objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa bar ma gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / bdag gi'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bar ma gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / bdag gi'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do //
translated: The two middle conceptualizations generate the view of the transitory collection and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa tha ma gsum gyis ni go rims bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha ma gsum gyis ni go rims bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug skyed par byed do //
translated: The last three conceptualizations generate attachment, hostility, and ignorance, respectively.

original: de la gnas dang dmigs pa'i dbang pos rten byas pa'i phyir ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: de la gnas dang dmigs pa'i dbang pos rten byas pa'i phyir ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
translated: The view of the transitory collection and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù are generated by the basis and the sense faculties that are the objects of the conceptualizations.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rten byas pas ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug bskyed de /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rten byas pas ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug bskyed de /
translated: Attachment, hostility, and ignorance are generated by the view of the transitory collection and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: des na dngos po gsum po 'di dag gis sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i phyogs ma lus par bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po gsum po 'di dag gis sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i phyogs ma lus par bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that all the aspects of the engagement of the world of sentient beings and the world of their vessels are revealed by these three things.

original: de dag ma nges yang na log par nges //
analyzed: de dag ma nges yang na log par nges //
translated: They are not ascertained or else they are wrongly ascertained.

original: 'khor bar shin tu yun ring 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor bar shin tu yun ring 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: They revolve for a long time in cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya bas ni 'khor bar 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'khor bar 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the disadvantage of revolving in cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gti mug gi stobs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi tshogs rnams gsum las yang na ni ma nges pa'i tshogs la gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gti mug gi stobs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi tshogs rnams gsum las yang na ni ma nges pa'i tshogs la gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the hosts of sentient beings are in three groups. Sometimes, the group that is not ascertained remains in the group that is not ascertained.

original: yang na ni log par nges pa'i tshogs la gnas pas 'khor bar shin tu yun ring por dngos po'i 'chi 'pho len cing tshogs rnam pa gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ni log par nges pa'i tshogs la gnas pas 'khor bar shin tu yun ring por dngos po'i 'chi 'pho len cing tshogs rnam pa gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Sometimes, the group that is wrongly ascertained remains in the group that is wrongly ascertained. They revolve for a long time in cyclic existence, taking on the death and rebirth of various states of existence. They remain in two groups.

original: tshogs rnam pa gsum po de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas thams cad yod par @129b smra ba'i gzhung gi bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: tshogs rnam pa gsum po de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas thams cad yod par @129b smra ba'i gzhung gi bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: These three collections are explained differently, so there are two explanations in the scriptures of the SarvƒÅstivƒÅdins.

original: dang po ni bstan bcos rnam grangs bsdus pa la brten nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bstan bcos rnam grangs bsdus pa la brten nas bshad pa ste /
translated: The first is the explanation based on the treatise Compendium of Categories.

original: de la sems can gyi phung po ni rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi phung po ni rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: Therein, the collection of sentient beings has three types.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The collection of those destined for error is as follows:

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i las yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i las yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the completion of the five heinous actions.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The collection of those destined for the authentic is as follows:

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the completion of the qualities of learners and nonlearners.

original: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The undetermined collection is as follows:

original: de las gzhan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su ma sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos yongs su ma sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the completion of qualities other than those, such as contaminated phenomena and unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ni phung po rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the nature of the three types of collections.

original: khams las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni khams gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: khams las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni khams gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The aggregate that is definitely not destined to return to the realm is one part of one realm.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi'o //
translated: It is the desire realm.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni khams gsum char gyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni khams gsum char gyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The aggregate that is definitely destined for reality is one part of three realms.

original: ma nges pa'i phung po ni khams gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phung po ni khams gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The aggregate that is not destined is one part of one realm.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi'o //
translated: It is the desire realm.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po yang de bzhin no //
translated: The aggregate that is definitely destined for reality is also like that.

original: 'gro ba las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gcig gi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The aggregate that is definitely not destined to return to the realm is one part of one realm.üîΩWhat is that?

original: 'di lta ste mi'i'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi'i'o //
translated: It is the human realm.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste 'di lta ste lha dang mi'i'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste 'di lta ste lha dang mi'i'o //
translated: The aggregate that is definitely destined for reality is one part of two realms. What are those two? They are the god realm and the human realm.

original: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gsum char tshang ba ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gsum char tshang ba ste /
translated: The aggregate that is not destined is the complete three realms.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are those three?

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dvags rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dvags rnams kyi'o //
translated: The realm of sentient beings refers to the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: One part of two realms refers to

original: lha dang mi'i'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i'o zhes bshad do //
translated: the gods and humans.

original: gnyis pa ni bstan bcos gnas gdags pa la brten nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bstan bcos gnas gdags pa la brten nas bshad pa ste /
translated: The second is explained in dependence on the treatise called Presentation on the World.

original: de las log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The aggregates that are determined to be the opposite of that are as follows:

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i las dang / de'i rgyu dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / de'i chos dang gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i las dang / de'i rgyu dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / de'i chos dang gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the five heinous actions, their causes, their results, their natural outflow, their fully ripened results, and the persons who are established in them.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The aggregates that are determined to be real are as follows:

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag gi 'bras bu dang / @130a * //
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag gi 'bras bu dang / @130a * //
translated: the phenomena of learners and nonlearners, their causes, their results,

original: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa dang / de dag gi gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa dang / de dag gi gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: their natural outflow, and the persons who are established in them.

original: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The indeterminate aggregate is as follows:

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag gi 'bras bu dang / de dag gi rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag gi 'bras bu dang / de dag gi rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / gang zag yongs su grub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: all other dharmas, their causes, their results, their natural outcome, their evolutionary development, and the person as a real, substantial entity.

original: 'di ni phung po rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the threefold aggregate.

original: khams las ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: khams las ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The realms are as before.

original: 'gro ba las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba las kyang log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The aggregate that is definitely wrong is one part of two realms,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang mi'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang mi'o //
translated: the hells and the human realm.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po de yang de bzhin du 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po de yang de bzhin du 'gro ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The aggregate that is definitely right is one part of two realms,

original: 'di lta ste lha dang mi'i'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha dang mi'i'o //
translated: the god realm and the human realm.üîΩThe indeterminate aggregate is one part of three realms,üîΩthe animal realm,

original: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis po dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / 'gro ba gsum gyi phyogs gcig ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phung po ni 'gro ba gnyis po dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / 'gro ba gsum gyi phyogs gcig ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: the ghost realm, and one part of the human realm.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The realms of sentient beings are the hells, gods, and humans.üîΩThe Sautrantikas say in their scriptures in the MahaVibhasa:

original: de la mdo sde pa'i gzhung ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du dpe can dag mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar der phung po rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bshad do /üîΩde dag las gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdo sde pa'i gzhung ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du dpe can dag mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar der phung po rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bshad do / de dag las gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the realm of sentient beings, from the Avici hell up to the summit of existence, there are three kinds of aggregates.üîΩThose that are destined for nirvana are called the aggregate of those destined for nirvana.

original: mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are not destined for nirvana are called the aggregate of those not destined for nirvana.

original: ma nges pa gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa gang yin pa de ni ma nges pa'i phung po zhes bya'o zhes zer ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Those that are not definite are called the aggregate of those not definite.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po brgya brgyad cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po brgya brgyad cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the Great Exegesis, which has 186,000 sections.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, the teaching of the Great Vehicle is applied.

original: mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: In brief, there are ten topics.

original: re zhig sa bcu la brten nas sa bcu'i mdo las /
analyzed: re zhig sa bcu la brten nas sa bcu'i mdo las /
translated: First, based on the ten levels, the Sutra of the Ten Levels states:

original: sgo rnam pa lngas tshogs rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang sbyar nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo rnam pa lngas tshogs rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang sbyar nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: The three collections are explained in terms of five topics.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi phung po rnam pa gsum po yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / gnyi ga la ma nges pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi phung po rnam pa gsum po yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / gnyi ga la ma nges pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Therefore, in that very sutra, it says that bodhisattvas know the three types of collections of sentient beings those who are definitely correct, those who are definitely incorrect, and those who are indefinite in both ways exactly as they are.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yang dag par nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yang dag par nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Correct view is the characteristic of definite correctness.

original: log pa'i lta ba ni log par nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba ni log par nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The wrong view is the characteristic of the wrong certainty.

original: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The absence of both is the characteristic of the uncertain.

original: mtshams med pa @130b lnga las gang yang rung ba ni log pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshams med pa @130b lnga las gang yang rung ba ni log pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Any one of the five sins of immediate retribution is the characteristic of the wrong certainty.

original: dbang po lnga ni yang dag pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni yang dag pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The five faculties are the characteristic of the right certainty.

original: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang bral ba ni ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The absence of both is the characteristic of the uncertain.

original: log pa brgyad ni log pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: log pa brgyad ni log pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eight wrongnesses are the characteristic of the wrong certainty.

analyzed: yang dag pa la gnas skabs ni yang dag pa la nges pa'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: gzhan du na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mos pa can dang / tha dad pa'i mos pa can dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mos ba can du gyur pas /

analyzed: gcig la gcig rgyab kyis phyogs shing rtsod pa'i smra ba bskyed nas kha'i mdung thung gis phan tshun 'debs par bgyid /

original: yid 'di ltar mu stegs can rnams rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su btsal kyang de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa khong du ma chud pas gzhan du na nor bas mos pa ni gsum du 'dzin par gyur te //
analyzed: yid 'di ltar mu stegs can rnams rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su btsal kyang de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa khong du ma chud pas gzhan du na nor bas mos pa ni gsum du 'dzin par gyur te //
translated: The mind is sought in various ways by the tƒ´rthikas, but because they do not understand the meaning of reality, they are attached to other things. They are attached to the three:

analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mos pa can dang / tha dad pa'i mos pa can rnam par 'gyur ba'i mos pa can du gyur pa'o //

original: rnam pa gsum du dbye ba ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du dbye ba ni med do //

original: kha cig na re rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mos pa can du gyur ces bya ba ni chos rnam pa sna tshogs la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i de bzhin 'dod ba'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtha dad pa'i mos ba can du gyur ces bya ba ni chos rnams las logs shig na don dam pa yod de /

analyzed: nges par chos thams cad dang tha dad ces 'dod pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i mos pa can zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i mos pa can du gyur ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i tshul du na don dam pa ni rnam par gyur pa med pa yin na /

original: kha cig na re tshig dang po ni spyi'o //

original: tshig gi don bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: mang po rnams kyis brtags kha cig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //

analyzed: bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //

analyzed: @138b gcig nas gcig tu brtags pa tha dad par gyur cing nges pa med pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: yid kyi las dang ngag gi las la mi mthun par gyur pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi las dang ngag gi las la mi mthun par gyur pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //

analyzed: tha mas ni lus kyi las gcig la gcig gnod pa byas pa bstan te /

original: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /

analyzed: kha'i ral gri dang dbyug pas gcig la gcig smas par byas pa las so sor gyes par gyur to zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de mu stegs mang po rnams dpyad cing yongs su btsal kyang ma rtogs par mthong nas don dam pa ni rtog dpyod kyi yul las shin tu 'das pa yin no snyam du yang sems la de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattvas saw that the many tƒ´rthikas had investigated and searched but had not realized it, they thought, ‚ÄúThe ultimate is completely beyond the realm of investigation and analysis.‚Äù

original: nas thabs shin tu legs par gsungs pa'i dbang gis /

analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /

analyzed: gnyis pa rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bshad par gsol ba btab pa rigs pa dang mthun par gyur cing /

original: le'u chen po'i mdo dang sbyar na /

original: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúSo it is, just as you have said.‚Äù

analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di nyid kyi 'grel ba slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa las / brgya byin lha'i dbang pos 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes the tshom za ba dang / nor bar 'dzin du dogs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig zlos bur de de bzhin no //

analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: mdo sde 'di yang de bzhin te /

original: thams cad la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: thams cad la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first:

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs pas /
translated: Thus, by the nonconceptual gnosis of the ƒÅryas observing the object of suchness,

original: nang gi rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the inner essence is realized.

original: nang gi so so rang gis rig pa 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: nang gi so so rang gis rig pa 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: This inner personal realization is explained differently by different ones.

original: kha cig na re rtsa ba dang / rjes las thob pa thams cad kyis nang gi rig pa'i de bzhin nyid thob bas /
analyzed: kha cig na re rtsa ba dang / rjes las thob pa thams cad kyis nang gi rig pa'i de bzhin nyid thob bas /
translated: Some say that since the suchness of the inner realization is attained by all the roots and subsequent attainments,

original: gzugs brnyan snang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang bar mi byed do //
translated: the appearance of reflections is not made.

original: 'di ltar zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //üîΩkha cig ni rtsa ba dang rjes la thob pa gnyis gzugs ba rnyan ston par byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o // kha cig ni rtsa ba dang rjes la thob pa gnyis gzugs ba rnyan ston par byed pas /
translated: Thus, because uncontaminated transcendent wisdom focuses on reality, it is not a representation.

original: mngon sum du rig pa ma yin te /üîΩgal te de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du rig pa ma yin te / gal te de lta ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The two, the root and subsequently attained wisdoms, do not directly perceive their objects because they display representations.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyis don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyis don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: If that were not so, then because objects would not be established by mere representations,

original: kha cig na re yang dag pa'i ye shes ni rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum du rtogs pas ma bsgyur bar yang dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re yang dag pa'i ye shes ni rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum du rtogs pas ma bsgyur bar yang dmigs par byed de /
translated: some say: Correct transcendent wisdom does not transform its own nature and directly perceives its object.

original: ji ltar rang gi rtogs pa'i rnam pa las rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan med pa bzhin no //üîΩrjes las thob pa'i ye shes gzugs brnyan du gyur pa las dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi rtogs pa'i rnam pa las rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan med pa bzhin no // rjes las thob pa'i ye shes gzugs brnyan du gyur pa las dmigs par byed de /
translated: Just as there is no other aspect of an object apart from the aspect that is its own realization,

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: subsequently attained wisdom perceives its object as a representation because it is conceptual.

original: gal te de ltar ma yin na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs @140a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma yin na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi yul la dmigs @140a * //
translated: If that were not so, then the mirrorlike gnosis and so on would not focus on suchness.üîΩ

original: pas yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes dang / rjes la thob par bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: pas yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes dang / rjes la thob par bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: If it were not so, then the mirror-like intuition, etc., would not be intuitions of the Absolute Body, and the intuition of the Absolute Body and the subsequent intuition would be indistinguishable.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although there are three explanations,

original: slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong gi gzhung gis 'og nas ston pa ni yang dag pa yin no //üîΩrgya cher bshad pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong gi gzhung gis 'og nas ston pa ni yang dag pa yin no // rgya cher bshad pa ni /
translated: the explanation of the master Hiuan-tsang and of Dharmapala is the correct one, as will be shown later.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is in accordance with the Vimshatika-vrtti and the Buddhabhumi-vyakhya.

original: rtog dpyod kyi spyod pa ni so so'i skye bo'i gzhan gyi dbang gi tha snyad de /
analyzed: rtog dpyod kyi spyod pa ni so so'i skye bo'i gzhan gyi dbang gi tha snyad de /
translated: The activity of investigation and analysis is the conventional of the other-dependent of the common man,

original: nang gi so so rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin par gsungs pa'i phyir phan tshun zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nang gi so so rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin par gsungs pa'i phyir phan tshun zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: because it is said to be not the inner, personal realization, and therefore it is said to be ‚Äúmutual‚Äù.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni rtog ge'i spyod yul zhes 'byung la mdo 'di las ni rtog dpyod kyi spyod yul las 'das ba zhes 'byung ba de ji ltar brda sprad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni rtog ge'i spyod yul zhes 'byung la mdo 'di las ni rtog dpyod kyi spyod yul las 'das ba zhes 'byung ba de ji ltar brda sprad par bya zhe na /
translated: How can this be reconciled?

original: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations.

original: dang po ni kha cig na re mdo sde dang / bstan bcos rnying 'gyur rnams las ni rtog ge zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang po ni kha cig na re mdo sde dang / bstan bcos rnying 'gyur rnams las ni rtog ge zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: First, some say that the older translations of the sutras and treatises have the term reasoning.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni rtog dpyod ces par bsgyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni rtog dpyod ces par bsgyur te /
translated: Master Hva-san translated it as investigation and analysis.

original: de la rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, investigation is as follows.

original: kun tu tshol ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu tshol ba'o //
translated: It is thorough searching.

original: dpyod pa ni so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: Analysis is discernment.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ji skad du thams cad kyang sems pa dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ji skad du thams cad kyang sems pa dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Levels of Yogic Deeds says, ‚ÄúAll of these are by nature either intention or wisdom.‚Äù

original: mdo sde 'di las rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la spyir rtog dpyod ces bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la spyir rtog dpyod ces bshad de /
translated: The term ‚Äúinvestigation and analysis‚Äù in this sutra is explained as investigation and analysis in general.

original: thams cad la yang yongs su tshol ba dang / don sems pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang yongs su tshol ba dang / don sems pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them have complete investigation and mental analysis of the meaning.

original: rtog dpyod ces bya ba 'di yang /
analyzed: rtog dpyod ces bya ba 'di yang /
translated: This term ‚Äúinvestigation and analysis‚Äù

original: so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: is explained differently in each treatise.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod de /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dag ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod de /
translated: Sarvastivadins say that mental factors exist as real entities separate from the mind.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar gyi sems can thams cad ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar gyi sems can thams cad ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings from the desire realm to the first absorption have investigation and analysis.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can rnams ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can rnams ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Those of the special absorptions have no investigation but have analysis.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad kyis rnams ni thams cad kyang rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad kyis rnams ni thams cad kyang rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Those of the second absorption and above have neither investigation nor analysis.

original: @140b de yang rnam par shes pa drug po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med ba la bsdu'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: @140b de yang rnam par shes pa drug po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med ba la bsdu'o zhes zer te /
translated: Moreover, they are subsumed in the six consciousnesses that are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the treatise Kosa and so on.

original: mdo sde pa dag ni sems las logs shig na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yang med la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ni sems las logs shig na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yang med la /
translated: Sautrantikas say that apart from mind, there is no intrinsic nature,

original: sems dang gcig pa ma yin par yang rtog pa dang / dpyod pa 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: sems dang gcig pa ma yin par yang rtog pa dang / dpyod pa 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: but it is not the same as mind, for investigation and analysis occur.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa'i nang nas /
translated: Therefore the treatise Establishing Reality states:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i le'u'i nang nas kha cig rtog pa dang dpyod pa sems gcig la yod do zhes zer bde ni mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i le'u'i nang nas kha cig rtog pa dang dpyod pa sems gcig la yod do zhes zer bde ni mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say that investigation and analysis exist in a single mind, but that is incorrect.

original: mdo sde ba yang phal cher theg pa chen po dang mthun te /
analyzed: mdo sde ba yang phal cher theg pa chen po dang mthun te /
translated: Sautrantikas are mostly in accord with Mahayana.

original: de la bye brag yod pa yang bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa'i gzhung gis ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes ston la theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis ni sems pa dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes ston pas so //
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa yang bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa'i gzhung gis ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes ston la theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis ni sems pa dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes ston pas so //
translated: The treatise Establishing Reality teaches that the nature of mind is the creator, and the Mahayana scriptures teach that the nature of intention and wisdom is the creator.üîΩAlso, the Sautrantika scriptures assert that the three realms are different, but the great treatise Vibhasa states:

original: gzhan yang mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis sa gsum tha dad pa 'dod pa yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa'i bar du kun kyang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde pa'i gzhung gis sa gsum tha dad pa 'dod pa yang bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa'i bar du kun kyang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: From the desire realm up to the peak of existence, all have investigation and analysis.

original: sa gsum po dag bye brag yod par bshad pa yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i dge ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa thams cad ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gsum po dag bye brag yod par bshad pa yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i dge ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa thams cad ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire realm, the virtuous mind of the first absorption that is concomitant with affliction, the unobscured neutral mind and so on are called the level possessing investigation and analysis vitarka and vicƒÅra.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The virtuous mind and neutral mind of the special first absorption and so on are called the level possessing no investigation but only analysis.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i sems la sogs pa ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The virtuous mind and unobscured neutral mind and so on from the second absorption to the summit of existence are called the level possessing neither investigation nor analysis.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, if this is applied to the Mahayana scriptures,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: it is as the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only explains:

original: rtog pa ni kun du tshol pa'i yid kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni kun du tshol pa'i yid kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: Conception is the expression of the mind that seeks in a gross manner.

original: rtsing bar 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rtsing bar 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It has the nature of engaging in a gross manner.

original: dpyod pa ni so sor rtog pa'i yid kyis brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni so sor rtog pa'i yid kyis brjod pa nyid de /
translated: Discrimination is the expression of the mind that analyzes in a subtle manner.

original: zhib par 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhib par 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It has the nature of engaging in a subtle manner.

original: @141a * // 'di gnyis ka yang lus dang sems reg par gnas pa dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: @141a * // 'di gnyis ka yang lus dang sems reg par gnas pa dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Both of these have the function of supporting the body and mind that remain in contact and not in contact.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi phyogs gcig gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: They are the nature of intention and one part of wisdom.

original: skad cig ma gcig la chos gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la chos gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Two dharmas do not simultaneously coexist in a single moment,

original: rtsing pa dang zhib pa'i rnam pas snga phyi tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtsing pa dang zhib pa'i rnam pas snga phyi tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: because they are different in terms of being gross and subtle.

original: rgya cher ni rnam par 'byed pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni rnam par 'byed pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi, the NyƒÅyaprave≈õa, the treatise Establishing Cognition Only, and so on.

original: sa gsum tha dad par gyur pa yang slob dpon hyan tsang gis 'di skad du bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la dgongs nas sa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: sa gsum tha dad par gyur pa yang slob dpon hyan tsang gis 'di skad du bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la dgongs nas sa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Master Xangzang explains the three levels as follows: The treatise YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi sets forth three levels with the intention of freedom from attachment to one's own nature.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, from the desire realm up to the first concentration, conditioned phenomena are called conceptual and analytical because attachment to one's own nature is not completely abandoned.

original: bsam gtan byad par can gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni sa 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan byad par can gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni sa 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: The conditioned phenomena of the first absorption are called free of investigation but with analysis because they are free of attachment to lower levels.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar gyi 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya
translated: The conditioned phenomena from the second absorption to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment are called the level free of investigation and analysis because they are free of the investigation and analysis that are attachment to one's own entity.üîΩThis is extensively explained in the commentary to the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi.

original: ste / rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no zhes bshad de 'dir rtog dpyod las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa yang rtog dpyod 'di la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ste / rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no zhes bshad de 'dir rtog dpyod las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa yang rtog dpyod 'di la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Here the statement that it is beyond investigation and analysis is made with the intention of referring to investigation and analysis.

original: gnyis pa ni kha cig na re 'dir rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa ni khams gsum pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la rtog dpyod ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kha cig na re 'dir rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa ni khams gsum pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la rtog dpyod ces bya ste /
translated: Some say: The term investigation and analysis here refers to investigation and analysis that are minds and mental factors of the three realms that possess the contaminants.

original: 'di ni chos lnga las rnam par rtog pas bsdus so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos lnga las rnam par rtog pas bsdus so //
translated: They are subsumed by investigation in the five topics.

original: rtog dpyod ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtog dpyod ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Investigation and analysis also have two types.

original: dang po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rtog dpyod rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rtog dpyod rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The first is the four investigations and analyses of the desire realm.

original: shes pa dag gi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: shes pa dag gi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
translated: They are explained as the nature of consciousness.

original: ming la sogs pa kun @141b du tshol zhing da dung ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa kun @141b du tshol zhing da dung ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they investigate names and so on and are not yet ascertained.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dir gsungs pa'i rtog dpyod nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dir gsungs pa'i rtog dpyod nyid de /
translated: The second is the investigation and analysis mentioned here.

original: khams gsum pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa la bya bas de'i phyir rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa la bya bas de'i phyir rtog dpyod ces gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: They are called investigation and analysis because they are minds and so on of the three realms that possess the contaminants.

analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi rjes su skyes pa so sor rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
translated: Therefore they are established as separate faculties because they are born in the wake of those results.

original: gzhan gsum gyi rjes su skyes pa dag la ni de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gsum gyi rjes su skyes pa dag la ni de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: But those born in the wake of the other three are not established as separate faculties because they do not have the aspect of their characteristics.

original: rgya cher ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as taught in the Great Commentary.

original: ci'i phyir sna la sogs pa'i dbang po gsum po dag la gcig tu bsdus nas bye brag phyed pa zhes bstan zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sna la sogs pa'i dbang po gsum po dag la gcig tu bsdus nas bye brag phyed pa zhes bstan zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why are the three faculties of nose, etc., combined into one and distinguished as one?

original: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: It is said that in the treatise called the Verses of the Teaching of Various Minds,

original: lung du mi ston spyod yul la //
analyzed: lung du mi ston spyod yul la //
translated: it is taught that the three faculties of nose, tongue, and bodyüîΩare distinguished as one because

original: bye brag phyed sems der 'jug ste //
analyzed: bye brag phyed sems der 'jug ste //
translated: the mind that engages them is neutral,

original: rjes su rnam shes gsum @147a * //üîΩskye bas // de ni bye brag phyed ces bya //
analyzed: rjes su rnam shes gsum @147a * // skye bas // de ni bye brag phyed ces bya //
translated: and because the three consciousnessesüîΩthat arise after them are also neutral.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That is why they are distinguished as one.

original: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las dri dang ro dang reg bya gsum ni lung du mi ston pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shi ba bzhin du shes pa med pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs ba dag gis logs shig tu bye brag phyed pa'i ming rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las dri dang ro dang reg bya gsum ni lung du mi ston pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shi ba bzhin du shes pa med pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs ba dag gis logs shig tu bye brag phyed pa'i ming rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the treatise called the Treasury of Abhidharma, the three faculties of smell, taste, and tactility are distinguished as one because they are neutral by nature, and because they are not known to exist after death.

original: drug pa yid kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa mi skye na yang rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid du 'grub pa dang / shes pa nyid du yang dag par 'grub pa nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa mi skye na yang rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid du 'grub pa dang / shes pa nyid du yang dag par 'grub pa nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the mental faculty consciousness does not arise, it would be established as the same aspect and it would be established as consciousness itself.

original: gal te de ltar ma yin na dgra bcom pa tha ma'i dran pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du grub bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma yin na dgra bcom pa tha ma'i dran pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du grub bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If it were not so, the final thought consciousness of an arhat would not be established as the mental faculty consciousness.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Teaching the Various Minds states:

original: yid kyi khams kyi rjes su skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyi rjes su skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The so-called consciousness that arises after the mental faculty

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir re zhig rjes su skyes pa zhes bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir re zhig rjes su skyes pa zhes bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is explained as arising after because it is asserted that the mental faculty is consciousness.

original: mdo sde pa dag gis rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag gis rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: SautrƒÅntikas explain that there are three types:

original: de yang de kho na nyid grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na de las tshad ma gsum la sogs pa brten nas mthong ba la sogs pa la rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na de las tshad ma gsum la sogs pa brten nas mthong ba la sogs pa la rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Moreover, if this is applied to the treatise establishing reality, it is analyzed in terms of seeing and so on based on the three valid cognitions and so on.üîΩTherefore, in the chapter teaching the eight conventions of that treatise, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tha snyad brgyad bstan pa'i le'u las mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tha snyad brgyad bstan pa'i le'u las mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between seeing, hearing, distinguishing and cognizing?

original: smras pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smras pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is said: There are three types.

original: mthong ba la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mthong ba la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: That which is confidence in seeing is direct perception.

original: thos pa la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lung ngo //
analyzed: thos pa la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lung ngo //
translated: That which is confidence in hearing is scriptural authority.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Cognizing is inferential knowledge.

original: bye brag phyed pa ni rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa ni rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Distinguishing is conceptualization.

original: yid ches pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum po 'di yang res 'ga' ni yang dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum po 'di yang res 'ga' ni yang dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: These three types of confidence are sometimes correct.

original: res 'ga' ni phyin ci log tu yang 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni phyin ci log tu yang 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes, it is the opposite.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the explanation in the Compendium.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis sems kyi yul mthong ba thos pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin pas de'i phyir gang gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba la @147b yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi yid ches pa zhes
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis sems kyi yul mthong ba thos pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin pas de'i phyir gang gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba la @147b yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi yid ches pa zhes
translated: Among them, that which is seen or heard by the mind through the six collections of consciousness is direct perception. Therefore, that which is called ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is the trust in what is said by one who has seen.

original: bya'o // yul la mi brten par lung la brten nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: bya'o // yul la mi brten par lung la brten nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya bas /
translated: That which is known through scripture without relying on an object is called ‚Äúheard.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir thos so zhes zer ba la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i gsung la yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thos so zhes zer ba la yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i gsung la yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is called ‚Äútrust in the words of the noble ones‚Äù is the trust in what is said by one who has heard.

original: ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa'i yul de dag la snga ma'i mthong ba dang thos pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pas shes pa gang yin ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa'i yul de dag la snga ma'i mthong ba dang thos pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pas shes pa gang yin ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that is obtained by inference in regard to those objects that are not seen or heard, on the basis of what has been seen or heard previously, is called the knowledge that is obtained by inference.

original: sems snga ma'i gsum pa'i rjes la yang nas yang du rnam par rtog pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems snga ma'i gsum pa'i rjes la yang nas yang du rnam par rtog pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is repeatedly discursive after the third moment of the mind that has seen or heard is called the mind that discriminates.

original: de yang ji ltar rnam par rtog ce na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rnam par rtog ce na /
translated: How does it discriminate?

original: sngar mthong ba'i rgyus yang nas yang du bsams nas lta ba'i 'du shes 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i rgyus yang nas yang du bsams nas lta ba'i 'du shes 'byung ba'am /
translated: The notion of seeing arises from repeatedly thinking about the cause of what was seen previously.

original: yang na snga ma'i lta ba las 'byung ba med pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba'i 'og tu bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na snga ma'i lta ba las 'byung ba med pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba'i 'og tu bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, that which arises from the previous seeing without a cause is called the discrimination that occurs after seeing.

original: thos pa dang rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu byung ba'i bye brag phyed pa bstan pa ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: thos pa dang rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu byung ba'i bye brag phyed pa bstan pa ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The teaching of the discrimination that occurs after hearing or cognizing is merely for the sake of communication.

original: bye brag phyed pa'i sems de yang mthong ba dang thos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i sems rnam pa gsum gyi 'og tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa'i sems de yang mthong ba dang thos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i sems rnam pa gsum gyi 'og tu 'byung ngo //
translated: This mental factor of discernment arises after the three types of mental factors of seeing, hearing, and knowing.

original: ma mthong ba dang ma thos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu yang skye ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang ma thos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu yang skye ste /
translated: It also arises after not seeing, not hearing, and not knowing.

original: dper na sngar ma mthong ba las phyis mthong ba brjod nas mthong ba'i 'du shes 'byung ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni ma mthong ba'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na sngar ma mthong ba las phyis mthong ba brjod nas mthong ba'i 'du shes 'byung ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni ma mthong ba'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúI see what I did not see before,‚Äù the notion of seeing arises after not seeing.

original: ma thos pa dang rnam par ma shes pa'i bye brag phyed ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma thos pa dang rnam par ma shes pa'i bye brag phyed ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The discernment of not hearing and not knowing should be understood in the same way.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
translated: If we relate this to the Abhidharmako≈õa,

original: de las ni slob dpon gnyis kyi bshad pa yod de /
analyzed: de las ni slob dpon gnyis kyi bshad pa yod de /
translated: there are two explanations by two masters.

original: slob dpon kha cig na re dbang po lnga po dag gis yul mngon sum du byas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig na re dbang po lnga po dag gis yul mngon sum du byas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One master says: The mind that perceives an object through the five sense faculties is called seeing.

original: gzhan yang brgyud de thos pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brgyud de thos pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, what is heard by way of a succession is called ‚Äúwhat is heard.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems bskyod de rigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su dpag pas snang ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems bskyod de rigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su dpag pas snang ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What appears by way of inference through various kinds of reasoning that moves one‚Äôs own mind is called ‚Äúdiscerned.‚Äù

original: yid kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin ba de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin ba de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What is made manifest by the mental faculty is called ‚Äúcognized.‚Äù

original: yul lnga po re re la mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
analyzed: yul lnga po re re la mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
translated: With regard to each of the five objects, there are four types of perception: seeing, hearing, discerning, and cognizing.

original: @148a * // yid kyi yul la ni mthong ba ma gtogs pa gsum yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: @148a * // yid kyi yul la ni mthong ba ma gtogs pa gsum yod do zhes bshad de /
translated: With regard to the object of the mental faculty, there are three types of perception: hearing, discerning, and cognizing, but not seeing.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: slob dpon 'di'i dgongs pa ni dbang po lnga po dag gis mngon sum gyi tshad mas thob pa gang yin pa de ni yul lnga po dag gsal ba'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon 'di'i dgongs pa ni dbang po lnga po dag gis mngon sum gyi tshad mas thob pa gang yin pa de ni yul lnga po dag gsal ba'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of this master is that what is obtained by the valid knowledge of direct perception through the five sense faculties is called ‚Äúseeing‚Äù because the five objects are clear.

original: lung gi tshad ma la brten nas brgyud de thos pa'i bye brag yul rnam pa bcu drug po gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma la brten nas brgyud de thos pa'i bye brag yul rnam pa bcu drug po gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The specific type of hearing that is based on scriptural authority and that is derived from the oral tradition is called ‚Äúlearning.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas rang gi sems bskyod de rigs pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su dpag bas snang ba'i yul drug po gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas rang gi sems bskyod de rigs pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su dpag bas snang ba'i yul drug po gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The specific type of reflection that is based on the authority of inference and that is derived from one‚Äôs own mind‚Äôs investigation of the various forms of reasoning is called ‚Äúreflection.‚Äù

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma la brten nas yul drug po dag mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma la brten nas yul drug po dag mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The specific type of knowledge that is based on the authority of direct perception and that is derived from the six kinds of objects that are perceived by the mental consciousness is called ‚Äúknowledge.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag gi rjes la mngon sum gyi tshad mas yul lnga po dag mngon sum du rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po de dag gi rjes la mngon sum gyi tshad mas yul lnga po dag mngon sum du rtogs pa'am /
translated: In this way, the mental consciousness that follows after the five kinds of sense consciousnesses is the direct perception that realizes the five kinds of objects.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma la gnas nas chos mngon sum du rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma la gnas nas chos mngon sum du rtogs pa'am /
translated: Or, it is the direct perception that realizes the Dharma by means of the authority of the mental consciousness that is based on the direct perception of the five kinds of sense consciousnesses.

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i yid mngon sum gyi tshad mas yul drug po dag mngon sum du byas pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i yid mngon sum gyi tshad mas yul drug po dag mngon sum du byas pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Or else, the mind directly perceives the six objects by means of the direct perception of the mind that abides in concentration.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: The former masters teach as follows:

original: mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba ni mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gis mngon sum du mthong ba ni mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is directly seen by the eye is called seen.

original: gzhan las brgyud de thos pa ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan las brgyud de thos pa ni thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is heard from another is called heard.

original: rang gi sems bskyod nas sna tshogs su bsams pas gzhal ba ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems bskyod nas sna tshogs su bsams pas gzhal ba ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is cognized by the mind that has been disturbed by various thoughts is called cognized.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang gi myong ba dang / bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du byas pa ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang gi myong ba dang / bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du byas pa ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: That which is experienced internally by oneself and made manifest by oneself is called known.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: The intention of this is taught as follows:

original: mig gi mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is seen by the direct perception of the eye is called seen.

original: mig 'ba' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba yang 'das pa'i gzugs kyi yul mchog tu gsal bar snang bas /
analyzed: mig 'ba' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba yang 'das pa'i gzugs kyi yul mchog tu gsal bar snang bas /
translated: The eye alone is called seeing because the object of past form appears most clearly to it.

original: de'i phyir mig 'ba' zhig mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig 'ba' zhig mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye alone is called seeing.

original: lung gi tshad ma la brten nas gzhan las brgyud de thos pa'i yul drug po gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas rang gi sems bskyod de /
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma la brten nas gzhan las brgyud de thos pa'i yul drug po gang yin pa de ni thos pa zhes bya'o // rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas rang gi sems bskyod de /
translated: Whatever objects of the six sense spheres are heard from others by means of oral testimony are called what is heard.

original: @148b sna tshogs su bsams pa dang / gzhal ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @148b sna tshogs su bsams pa dang / gzhal ba gang yin pa de ni bye brag phyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is conceived by one's own mind, by means of inferential valid knowledge, in various ways, and whatever is evaluated, is called what is discerned.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum gyi tshad mar gyur pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus la brten nas bdag nyid kyis myong ba'i yul rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi dbang po'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i yul drug po gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum gyi tshad mar gyur pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus la brten nas bdag nyid kyis myong ba'i yul rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi dbang po'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i yul drug po gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa zhes ston to //
translated: Moreover, the four objects that are experienced by oneself in dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, and body, which are valid direct perception, and the six objects that are directly perceived by the valid direct perception of the mental faculty‚Äîall of these are called consciousness.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mthong ba ni mig 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mthong ba ni mig 'ba' zhig go //
translated: When applied to this explanation, seeing is only the eye.

original: thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa ni yid kho na'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa ni yid kho na'o //
translated: Hearing and discrimination are only the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang ngo //
translated: Consciousness is the faculties of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty.

original: yul rnam pa drug las gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi char skyed par byed do //
analyzed: yul rnam pa drug las gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi char skyed par byed do //
translated: From among the six objects, form generates all four types.

original: sgra la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni gzhan gyi thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsum po dag skyed bar byed do //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni gzhan gyi thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsum po dag skyed bar byed do //
translated: The five sense objects such as sound are the objects of the three sense faculties of others, namely, hearing, discerning and consciousness.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos rnams kyang so so nas mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos rnams kyang so so nas mi mthun te /
translated: Here, the Mahayana treatises are not in agreement.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom says:

Here,
