analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya'i nyon mongs pa spangs bas 'thob pa'i 'dus ma byas yin te /
translated: The two uncontaminated states obtained by abandoning afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are unconditioned states.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu thob pa'i tshe cig car de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu thob pa'i tshe cig car de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are obtained simultaneously with obtaining their result.

original: gnyis pa shes rab kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam pa dgu las phyi ma'i rnam pa gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa shes rab kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa ni 'di lta ste / 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam pa dgu las phyi ma'i rnam pa gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas yin te /
translated: The second is not directly perceived by wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis dmigs par byed kyang da dung ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dmigs par byed kyang da dung ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated state obtained by abandoning afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation on the three latter aspects of the desire realm is not directly perceived by wisdom because although it is observed by wisdom, it is not yet obtained.

original: gsum pa lus dang shes rab gnyis kas mngon sum du byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa lus dang shes rab gnyis kas mngon sum du byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is directly perceived by both body and wisdom.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba las snga ma'i rnam pa drug dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi bden pa bzhi'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o //üîΩbzhi pa lus dang shes rab gnyis kas mngon sum du ma byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba las snga ma'i rnam pa drug dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi bden pa bzhi'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o // bzhi pa lus dang shes rab gnyis kas mngon sum du ma byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is unconditioned that is obtained by abandoning the afflictions of the desire realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob pa'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is unconditioned that is obtained by abandoning the afflictions of the two higher realms that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩWhy is that?

original: @165a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa bsnan te brtag pa zhes bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: @165a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa bsnan te brtag pa zhes bya ba nyid de /
translated: This is the fourth reason that is stated.üîΩWhy is it profound?

original: ci'i phyir zab par gyur pa gtan tshigs brtag pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zab par gyur pa gtan tshigs brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the reason.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa de bzhin gshegs pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa de bzhin gshegs pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: This is taught by the fifth chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Extensive Explanation by the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: 'di yang rnam grangs rnam pa gsum gyis ston pas de nyid las rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam grangs rnam pa gsum gyis ston pas de nyid las rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: This is also divided into three topics by the three enumerations.

original: de yang dang po ni skyon rnam pa gsum dang lnga la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do //
analyzed: de yang dang po ni skyon rnam pa gsum dang lnga la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do //
translated: The first is the destruction of the apprehension of sameness and difference based on three and five faults.

original: gnyis pa ni blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid de rnam par dag pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do //üîΩgsum pa ni blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba man chad 'du byed tha dad pa med pa dang bdag med pa la sogs
analyzed: gnyis pa ni blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba man chad kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid de rnam par dag pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do // gsum pa ni blo gros shin tu rnam dag gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med par gyur na ni zhes bya ba man chad 'du byed tha dad pa med pa dang bdag med pa la sogs
translated: The second is from ‚ÄúS≈´rataprabha, if the characteristic of ultimate truth and the characteristic of formations were not different from each other‚Äù and so on, which destroys grasping at sameness and difference based on the purity of the general characteristic.

original: pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad do //
translated: The third is from ‚ÄúS≈´rataprabha, if the characteristic of ultimate truth and the characteristic of formations were not different from each other‚Äù and so on, which destroys grasping at sameness and difference based on the nondifference of formations and selflessness and so on.

original: rnam grangs dang po de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang po de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first category is also divided into two.

original: mi mthun par bshad pas 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa dang / rjes su mthun par bshad pas 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par bshad pas 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa dang / rjes su mthun par bshad pas 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa'o //
translated: The destruction of grasping through explanation that is not in accordance with the way things are, and the destruction of grasping through explanation that is in accordance with the way things are.

original: mi mthun par bshad pas rnam par 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mi mthun par bshad pas rnam par 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The destruction of grasping through explanation that is not in accordance with the way things are is also twofold:

original: skyon rnam pa gsum la brten nas gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa dang / skyon rnam pa lnga la brten nas tha dad pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: skyon rnam pa gsum la brten nas gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa dang / skyon rnam pa lnga la brten nas tha dad pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
translated: the destruction of grasping at identity through reliance on three faults, and the destruction of grasping at difference through reliance on five faults.

original: gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te smos pa dang / yang dag par gzhig pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te smos pa dang / yang dag par gzhig pa ste /
translated: The destruction of grasping at identity is also taught through two aspects: the mere statement of identity, and the correct refutation of identity.

original: 'di ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa smos pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa smos pa nyid do //
translated: This is the mere statement of identity.

original: 'dir so so'i skye bo thams cad bden pa mthong pa yin par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir so so'i skye bo thams cad bden pa mthong pa yin par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Here, ‚Äúall ordinary beings would come to see the truth‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyis pa skyon rnam pa gsum gyis gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa yang dag @165b par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa skyon rnam pa gsum gyis gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa yang dag @165b par gzhig pa'o //
translated: The second is the correct refutation of grasping at identity through three faults.

original: de la skyon rnam pa gsum ni so so'i skye bo rnams bden pa'i tshul mthong bar gyur pa'i skyon dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skyon dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de la skyon rnam pa gsum ni so so'i skye bo rnams bden pa'i tshul mthong bar gyur pa'i skyon dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skyon dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skyon no //
translated: The three faults are: the fault of ordinary beings seeing the way things really are, the fault of attaining nirvana, and the fault of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'di ni so so'i skye bo rnams bden pa'i tshul mthong ba'i skyon bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni so so'i skye bo rnams bden pa'i tshul mthong ba'i skyon bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the teaching on the fault of ordinary beings seeing the way things really are.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gal te 'du byed rnams nyid yang dag pa'i tshul yin no zhes 'dod na 'o na ni so so'i skye bo'i gzugs mthong ba rnams kyang bden pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams nyid yang dag pa'i tshul yin no zhes 'dod na 'o na ni so so'i skye bo'i gzugs mthong ba rnams kyang bden pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: If you assert that formations themselves are the way things really are, then it would be logical that ordinary beings who see form would see the truth,

original: gzugs nyid yang dag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid yang dag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form itself is the meaning of reality.

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo rnams bla na med pa'i thabs kyi shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo rnams bla na med pa'i thabs kyi shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it would be said that ordinary beings would attain unsurpassed, blissful nirvana through skillful means.

original: gnyis pa so so'i skye bo yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skyon bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa so so'i skye bo yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skyon bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The second half shows the error in the attainment of nirvana by ordinary men.

original: bla na med pa'i thabs zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i thabs zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The unexcelled means is the truth of the path,

original: zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: the undefiled path of the noble ones.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Nirvana is of four kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / mi gnas pa ste /
translated: natural, pure by nature; with remainder, without remainder, and nonabiding.

original: phyis rnam par 'byed do /
analyzed: phyis rnam par 'byed do /
translated: The latter three will be explained later.

original: 'dir ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang sbyar te gzod ma nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang sbyar te gzod ma nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the nirvana with remainder and the nonabiding nirvana are to be understood as natural, pure by nature, because they exist from the beginning.

original: lhag ma med pa ni lus 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa ni lus 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nirvana without remainder is not so, because the body has already ceased.

original: yang na 'dir lhag ma med pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na 'dir lhag ma med pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Or, here the nirvana without remainder is to be understood as

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa bkag nas lhag ma med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa bkag nas lhag ma med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nirvana with remainder is negated and the nirvana without remainder is attained.

original: thabs kyi lam smos pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: thabs kyi lam smos pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: By mentioning the path of means, the result of nirvana is indicated.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i thabs kyi shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i thabs kyi shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that nirvana is the unsurpassed bliss of means.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa so so'i skye bo yang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skyon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa so so'i skye bo yang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skyon bstan pa'o //
translated: One will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment indicates the third fault of even an ordinary being attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin na so so'i skye bo rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyang khong du chud par 'gyur @166a * //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin na so so'i skye bo rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyang khong du chud par 'gyur @166a * //
translated: If they are not different, then it would be logical that ordinary beings would also comprehend the characteristic of ultimate truth, which is the characteristic of conditioned phenomena such as form,

original: ba'i rigs te gzhan du 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang tha dad par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i rigs te gzhan du 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang tha dad par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would not be different from conditioned phenomena in any other way.

original: des na bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would be a fault to manifest unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon sum du byed cing thob par byed pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed cing thob par byed pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It should be understood that they are not the same because one manifests and the other is attained.

original: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa skyon rnam pa lnga la brten nas tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad de /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa skyon rnam pa lnga la brten nas tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad de /
translated: From ‚ÄúIf the characteristic of ultimate truth and the characteristic of conditioned phenomena were different‚Äù up to ‚Äúit would not be ultimate truth,‚Äù the second refutes the apprehension of difference based on five faults.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: smos pa dang rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: smos pa dang rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: stating the faults and refuting the rebuttal.

original: 'dir ni rnam par gzhig par dgongs nas sngar tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par gzhig par dgongs nas sngar tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Here, intending to refute, he first states the apprehension of difference.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / gal te ma 'dres par tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni skyon rnam pa lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / gal te ma 'dres par tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni skyon rnam pa lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of conditioned things that are ultimate truths, and if they were different in the sense of being unmixed, then there would be five faults. This is the meaning.

original: bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma yongs su gsal bar me 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa skyon rnam pa lnga rnam par phye nas ston to //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma yongs su gsal bar me 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa skyon rnam pa lnga rnam par phye nas ston to //
translated: And those who have seen the truth would not completely eliminate the signs of conditioned things. From here on, the second part is taught, which is the analysis and explanation of the five faults.

original: skyon rnam pa lnga ni bden pa mthong ba rnams 'du byed kyi mtshan ma mi spong ba'i skyon dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par mi 'grol ba'i skyon dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par mi 'grol ba'i skyon dang /
analyzed: skyon rnam pa lnga ni bden pa mthong ba rnams 'du byed kyi mtshan ma mi spong ba'i skyon dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par mi 'grol ba'i skyon dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par mi 'grol ba'i skyon dang /
translated: The five faults are: the fault of those who have seen the truth not abandoning the signs of conditioned things, the fault of not being liberated from the bondage of signs, the fault of not being liberated from the bondage of negative tendencies,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i skyon dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon du mi byed pa'i skyon to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i skyon dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon du mi byed pa'i skyon to //
translated: the fault of not actualizing nirvana, and the fault of not actualizing unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'di ni dang po 'du byed kyi mtshan ma mi spong ba'i skyon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po 'du byed kyi mtshan ma mi spong ba'i skyon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first fault, that of not abandoning the signs of formative influence.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the signs of formative influence,

original: 'du byed ni 'di la ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'di la ste /
translated: formative influence is that which is here.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa dmigs par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa dmigs par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness that objectifies the aspects of the view.

original: mtshan ma ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste 'di ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste 'di ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The signs are the aspects of the signs. This is called the signs of formative influence.

original: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas te rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas te rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the dominant condition.

original: yang na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la 'du byed ni /
analyzed: yang na 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba la 'du byed ni /
translated: Alternatively, as for the signs of formative influence, formative influence is that which is here.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: skye 'gag dang bcas pa rnam par 'gyur zhing mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skye 'gag dang bcas pa rnam par 'gyur zhing mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is that which is subject to origination and cessation, is subject to change and is not stable.

original: mtshan ma ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The signs are the characteristics of its nature.

original: rnam par @166b gzhig pa ni 'di skad du gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan gcig tu tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na 'o na ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma yongs suüîΩspong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par @166b gzhig pa ni 'di skad du gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan gcig tu tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na 'o na ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan ma yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The analysis is as follows: If the ultimate truth and the characteristics of formations were the same, then those who see the truth would also abandon the characteristics of formations.

original: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa 'du byed rnams dang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa 'du byed rnams dang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that case, the ultimate truth would be different from formations.

original: 'on kyang spong par yang byed pas de'i phyir tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang spong par yang byed pas de'i phyir tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But since they do abandon them, therefore they are not different.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar spong zhe na /

analyzed: sems shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag chos kyi mtshan ma ma spangs shing 'ching ba gnyis las ma grol bas zhes bshad pas de'i phyir 'dir mtshan ma'i yongs su bsal ba zhes gsungs pa ni stong

analyzed: bshad pa nyid dang sbyar na mtshan ma nyid 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ste /

analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa de nyid las 'ching bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ste /

original: rnam par rags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rags pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The aspect of the view that objectifies and the passions such as craving are called the ‚Äúbond of the propensities.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang rtogs par byed de /

analyzed: kha cig na re mtshan ma'i 'ching ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi bdag nyid do zhes zer ba de ni 'di skad du nyon mongs pa'i yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag gi mthu'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug

analyzed: dang po rnam par shes pa drug dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /

analyzed: kha cig na re gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi lta ba'i rnam pa'i sa bon dang dbang po'o //
translated: Some say that what is called negative conditioning is the seeds and faculties of the views of the afflictions.

analyzed: 'ching ba ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa'i sa bon no //

analyzed: gzhan yang mngon du byung ba'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa yang @168a * //
translated: Moreover, the arising of the signs is

analyzed: 'ching ba gnyis yin no zhe'o //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the treatise teaching the three kinds of unreality,

analyzed: de las 'di skad du /

analyzed: srid pa las grol ba'i mdo las kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The imagined reality is called the affliction of signs.üîΩThe dependent reality is called the affliction of negative reflex actions.üîΩMoreover, in that same treatise, in the section on the analysis of the afflictions of signs and the afflictions of negative reflex actions,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas /
translated: it says:

original: kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid 'byung ba na /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid 'byung ba na /
translated: When the imagined reality arises,

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sems can rnams 'ching bar byed de /

analyzed: mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions of signs and the afflictions of negative reflex actions.

original: de la mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The afflictions of signs are the imagined nature.

analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyon mongs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The afflictions of negative reflex actions are the relative nature.

translated: This is the way the afflictions are established. They are established because of the grasping of the imagined nature in the relative nature.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to this passage says:

original: kun du rtog pa la mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa yang mtshan ma ni dbyibs kyi mtshan ma la dbyibs kyi mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa zhes bshad pas /

translated: The afflictions of signs in imagination are explained as the afflictions of the signs of shape in the signs of shape.

original: rkyen byed pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen byed pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called the afflictions that act as conditions.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa yang dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa yang dag pa yin no //
translated: The relative nature is the real affliction.

original: de la lci yang bstan pa yang kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa kho na'i rkyen yin pas nyon mongs pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de la lci yang bstan pa yang kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa kho na'i rkyen yin pas nyon mongs pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The teaching on weight and lightness also explains that the imagined nature is the condition of just the afflictions, so it is called the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir yang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called light.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa yin pas de'i phyir lci ba zhes bshad do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa yin pas de'i phyir lci ba zhes bshad do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The dependent nature is the reality of the nature of the afflictions, so it is called heavy.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The Vrtti explains this in accordance with that passage.üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni mtshan ma dang // gnas ngan len gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni mtshan ma dang // gnas ngan len gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The dependent nature is the reality of the nature of the afflictions.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it called the dependent nature?

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis phan tshun rkyen byas na skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis phan tshun rkyen byas na skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises through the power of these two aspects, which act as conditions for each other.

original: 'di ltar mtshan mas rkyen byas nas ni gnas ngan len bskyed la /

translated: then, since one would have already understood the meaning of those objects, such as seeing, just as they are seen, it would not be reasonable to subsequently seek the ultimate.

original: yang don dam pa yongs su tshol ba yang yod pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang don dam pa yongs su tshol ba yang yod pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But because there is also the seeking of the ultimate, one should understand that they are not the same.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and cognizing is as explained above.

original: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the characteristics of the ultimate truth and the characteristics of the conditioned would be different,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa de don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa de don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni /
translated: If the mere selflessness of compounded phenomena and the mere essencelessness of compounded phenomena were not the characteristics of ultimate reality,

original: gnyis pa bdag med pa la sogs pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa bdag med pa la sogs pa la brten nas gcig pa dang tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa ston to //
translated: From here onward, the second part, the refutation of the apprehension of sameness and difference based on selflessness, etc., is presented.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: bdag med pa tsam la sogs pa la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas tha dad par 'dod pa rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa tsam la sogs pa la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas tha dad par 'dod pa rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: the refutation of the apprehension of difference based on the mere selflessness, etc., and the refutation of the claim that they are different because they have distinct characteristics.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /üîΩ'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams thams cad bdag med pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste / 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams thams cad bdag med pa tsam mo //
translated: This is the first.üîΩThus, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are mere selflessness.

original: chos rnams thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa tsam mo zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa tsam mo zhes gsungs pas /
translated: All phenomena are mere essencelessness.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam pa ni 'du byed thams cad dang tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa ni 'du byed thams cad dang tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate is not different from all conditioned phenomena.

original: tha dad par gyur na ni @172b 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur na ni @172b 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it were different, it would not be distinguished by the mere selflessness and the mere naturelessness of conditioned phenomena. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the characteristics of the specific would be established as simultaneous.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas tha dad pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas tha dad pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of defilement and the characteristics of purification. This is the second refutation of the assertion of difference, because the characteristics of the specific are not established.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The words of this s≈´tra are explained differently.

original: kha cig na re gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ming la sogs pa'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan yongs su bsal bas mtshan ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur pa ste
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ming la sogs pa'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan yongs su bsal bas mtshan ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur pa ste
translated: This is the actualization of the suchness devoid of signs through the complete elimination of the reflection of the entity of things such as names.

original: / de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa mngon du gyur ba na mtshan ma rnams mngon du snang bar mi 'gyur la mtshan ma rnams mngon du gyur pa'i tshe ni mtshan ma med pa mngon du snang bar ma gyur bas /
analyzed: / de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa mngon du gyur ba na mtshan ma rnams mngon du snang bar mi 'gyur la mtshan ma rnams mngon du gyur pa'i tshe ni mtshan ma med pa mngon du snang bar ma gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, when signlessness is actualized, signs do not appear and when signs are actualized, signlessness does not appear.

original: de'i phyir dus gcig tu grub pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gcig tu grub pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be posited that they are established at the same time.

original: gal te 'og nas bshad pa ltar gcig tu tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: gal te 'og nas bshad pa ltar gcig tu tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: If they were different as explained below, it would be logical that the specific characteristics would be established at the same time.

original: mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i ji lta ba bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i ji lta ba bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Because their characteristics are distinct, like form, sound, etc.

original: kha cig na re gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gnyis 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhan yang dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gnyis 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: Some say: Also, it is logical that two phenomena, the characteristics of which are distinct, would be established simultaneously, such as affliction and purification.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa dang / 'du byed yongs kyis tha dad pa'i phyir des na rnam par byang ba'i mchog tu gyur pa mthong ba'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs la /
analyzed: don dam pa dang / 'du byed yongs kyis tha dad pa'i phyir des na rnam par byang ba'i mchog tu gyur pa mthong ba'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs la /
translated: Because the ultimate and the conditioned are completely different, it is illogical that when the supreme state of purification is seen, affliction is abandoned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mthong ba'i tshe yang rnam par byang ba la sgrib par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mthong ba'i tshe yang rnam par byang ba la sgrib par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhe'o //
translated: And it is illogical that when affliction is seen, it would not obscure purification.

original: kha cig na re don dam pa dang / 'du byed tha dad par gyur na ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re don dam pa dang / 'du byed tha dad par gyur na ni /
translated: Some say: If the ultimate and the conditioned were different,

original: dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid chos rnams thams cad gzod ma nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gzod ma nas rnam par byang ba nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu bye brag gi mtshan nyid chos rnams thams cad gzod ma nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gzod ma nas rnam par byang ba nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: At one time, it would be reasonable to establish that all phenomena, the characteristics of the particulars, are primordially afflicted and primordially purified.

original: @173a * // 'on kyang mdo sde dag las de dag gi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: @173a * // 'on kyang mdo sde dag las de dag gi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: However, in the s≈´tras it is said that their nature is pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams dang / don dam pa'i bden pa tha dad pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩyang na kun rdzob ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams dang / don dam pa'i bden pa tha dad pa ma yin par rig par bya'o // yang na kun rdzob ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the formations and ultimate truth are not different.üîΩMoreover, it should not be said that the conventional is the ultimate,

original: don dam pa ni kun rdzob bo zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni kun rdzob bo zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: or that the ultimate is the conventional,

original: yongs kyis so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yongs kyis so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because they are completely different from each other.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i rnam par bshad pa yod pa ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i rnam par bshad pa yod pa ni mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: The master's explanation of the correct truth is not presented here for fear of being too wordy.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag 'di 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid thams cad bye brag yod pa yin gyi bye brag med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun par rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag 'di 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid thams cad bye brag yod pa yin gyi bye brag med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rjes su mthun par rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pas /
translated: ‚ÄúO Ceta·πâsüîΩof Pure Intellect, all the characteristics of conditioned things are distinct, not indistinct.‚Äù

original: gcig pa dang tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig par mdzad do //
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig par mdzad do //
translated: From here on, the second [reason] is the reasoning of the subsequent explanation, which refutes the apprehension of sameness and difference.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa de rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: refuting the apprehension of non-difference based on the two characteristics, and refuting the apprehension of difference based on the two characteristics.

original: dang po'i mtshan nyid de rnam pa gnyis po de nyid las rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po'i mtshan nyid de rnam pa gnyis po de nyid las rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The first is divided into two based on those two characteristics, making two parts.

original: 'di ni dang po bdag nyid bye brag tu gyur pa la brten nas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa de 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po bdag nyid bye brag tu gyur pa la brten nas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa de 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the first, which refutes the apprehension of non-difference based on the individual.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag 'du byed rnams la ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bye brag phyed pa dang / ji ltar rnam par shes pa las dus gzhan du don dam pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa yang don dam pa yongs su tshol bar byed pas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag 'du byed rnams la ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bye brag phyed pa dang / ji ltar rnam par shes pa las dus gzhan du don dam pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa yang don dam pa yongs su tshol bar byed pas tha dad pa ma yin par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The yogis and yoginis, with regard to the formations, seek the ultimate at another time from what they have seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself makes this clear.üîΩMoreover, the mere selflessness and the mere naturelessness of the formations are distinguished by the so-called characteristic of the ultimate.

original: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig par mdzad pa ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig par mdzad pa ston te /
translated: From here on, the second part is shown, the refutation of the apprehension of difference based on the two kinds of characteristics.

original: 'di ni dang po bdag med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i don gyis tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po bdag med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i don gyis tha dad par 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: This is the destruction of the apprehension of difference based on the meaning of the first, which is distinguished by the mere selflessness.

original: gzhan yang dus gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang @173b ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang @173b ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, since the characteristics of both the afflictions and purification are not established as different at one time,

original: gnyis pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa bye brag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa la brten nas tha dad par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
translated: this is the destruction of the apprehension of difference based on the non-difference of characteristics.

original: mdo dag las ji skad du chos rnams thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo dag las ji skad du chos rnams thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said in the s≈´tras, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are merely naturally pure.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do zhes zer ba dang / tha dad do zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni skyon rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do zhes zer ba dang / tha dad do zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni skyon rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion of the teaching of two faults.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: rigs pas spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang / brtags pa smos nas bzlas te mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pas spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang / brtags pa smos nas bzlas te mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the general conclusion through reasoning and the conclusion through repetition by mentioning the investigation.

original: 'di ni dang po rigs pas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i mjug spyir bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rigs pas gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i mjug spyir bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the first, the general conclusion through reasoning of the refutation of the apprehension of sameness and difference.

original: gal te de la 'di skad ces don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do zhe 'am /
analyzed: gal te de la 'di skad ces don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med do zhe 'am /
translated: If one says this, then if one says that the characteristic of ultimate truth and the characteristic of formations are either not different or different, that is not reasonable.

original: tha dad do zhes zer na rigs pa des thams cad tshul bzhin du spyod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: tha dad do zhes zer na rigs pa des thams cad tshul bzhin du spyod pa ma yin pas /
translated: By that reasoning, one does not properly engage in all things.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin byed pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa brtags pa smos nas bzlas te 'jug pa gcig pa dang / tha dad par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin byed pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa brtags pa smos nas bzlas te 'jug pa gcig pa dang / tha dad par 'dzin pa 'jig par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The phrase should be understood as not being in accord with the correct method is a second repetition after the word examination and it destroys the grasping of identity and difference.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself makes this clear.

original: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de bzhin nyid dang mtshan nyid gcig pa'am tha dad par gyur na skyon rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang /üîΩgzhan yang bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa las chos dang gang zag la brten nas /
analyzed: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las de bzhin nyid dang mtshan nyid gcig pa'am tha dad par gyur na skyon rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa las chos dang gang zag la brten nas /
translated: The treatise Teaching the Buddha-essence, the teaching of the three types of naturelessness, and the Bodhisattva Levels teach that if suchness were identical with or different from the characteristics, there would be three types of faults.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig pa dag ston te /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob gcig pa dang tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'jig pa dag ston te /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Teaching the Buddha-essence teaches the destruction of the grasping of the ultimate and the conventional as being identical or different in dependence on the person and the teaching.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not cite any more.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag dper na dung gi dkar ba nyid ni dung dkar ba gcig pa'am /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag dper na dung gi dkar ba nyid ni dung dkar ba gcig pa'am /
translated: O Caitra, the whiteness of the conch is not easily designated as the same as or different from the white conch.

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa dpe smos nas bzlas te rnam par bshad pa ston @174a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa dpe smos nas bzlas te rnam par bshad pa ston @174a * //
translated: The passage beginning with this example up to the third explanation is the explanation of the repetition of the example.

original: te / dpe rnam pa bcus ston pas de nyid las rnam pa bcur dbye'o //
analyzed: te / dpe rnam pa bcus ston pas de nyid las rnam pa bcur dbye'o //
translated: The ten examples are taught in the Ten Teaching Sutra.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu yod kyang go rims bzhin du yul rnam pa drug dang sbyar nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu yod kyang go rims bzhin du yul rnam pa drug dang sbyar nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Although there are ten such examples, they should be explained in order as corresponding to the six objects.

original: de yang dang po gnyis ni gzugs kyi dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: de yang dang po gnyis ni gzugs kyi dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: The first two are from the perspective of form.

original: de'i 'og ma gcig ni sgra'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gcig ni sgra'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: The next one is from the perspective of sound.

original: de'i 'og ma gcig ni dri'i dbang du mdzad nas so //üîΩde'i 'og ma gnyis ni ro'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gcig ni dri'i dbang du mdzad nas so // de'i 'og ma gnyis ni ro'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: The next one is from the perspective of smell.üîΩThe next two are from the perspective of taste.

original: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni reg bya'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis ni reg bya'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: The next two are from the perspective of tactility.

original: tha ma gnyis ni chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni chos kyi dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: The last two are from the point of view of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni dang po dung gi dkar ba gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po dung gi dkar ba gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first example of the conch and its whiteness being the same and different.

original: dung ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi dper bstan te /
analyzed: dung ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi dper bstan te /
translated: The conch is an example of the characteristics of the formations.

original: yul bzhi po dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul bzhi po dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the four objects are different.

original: dkar ba nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i dper bstan te /
analyzed: dkar ba nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i dper bstan te /
translated: Whiteness is an example of ultimate truth.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kun la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kun la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of form pervades all.

original: ji ltar dung dang dkar ba nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ba bzhin du yul bzhi po'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dung dang dkar ba nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ba bzhin du yul bzhi po'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is not suitable to say that the conch and its whiteness are the same, the nature of form of the four objects is also different as a generality and as a particular.

original: yang na spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: yang na spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: Or, because the generality and particular are different, it is also not suitable to say they are different.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have a different nature.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las gsum pa dpe brjod pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las gsum pa dpe brjod pa ni /
translated: In the commentary on the true meaning by the master Ye shes sde, the third example is stated as follows:

original: dbang po rnon po dang rtul po dag gi thabs yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang rtul po dag gi thabs yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: The method of teaching is for those of sharp and dull faculties.

original: gal te don 'ba' zhig bshad pa la /
analyzed: gal te don 'ba' zhig bshad pa la /
translated: If only the meaning is taught,

original: dpe rnam pa ma bzhag na dbang po rnon po nyi tshe 'jug par nus kyi dbang po rtul po dag gis 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: dpe rnam pa ma bzhag na dbang po rnon po nyi tshe 'jug par nus kyi dbang po rtul po dag gis 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: then only those of sharp faculties can understand it, but those of dull faculties cannot understand it.

original: gal te dpe dang don gnyis ka phun sum tshogs par bstan na dbang po rnon po dang / rtul po gnyis kas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po zab pa ma yin pa la ltos nas tshul zab mo mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dpe dang don gnyis ka phun sum tshogs par bstan na dbang po rnon po dang / rtul po gnyis kas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po zab pa ma yin pa la ltos nas tshul zab mo mtshon pa yin no //
translated: If both the example and the meaning are taught perfectly, then both those of sharp and dull faculties can understand it. Therefore, the profound method is taught in dependence on the non-profound meaning.

original: 'dir yul drug po dag dper bstan pa yang /
analyzed: 'dir yul drug po dag dper bstan pa yang /
translated: Here, the six objects are taught as examples.

original: gal te rnam pa gcig khong du chud na gzhan ni zlas shes bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gcig khong du chud na gzhan ni zlas shes bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: If one understands one aspect, the others are understood by implication.

original: gal te dkar ba nyid dang dung ni gcig ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dkar ba nyid dang dung ni gcig ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that whiteness and the conch are the same,

original: 'on ni gzugs nyi tshe dung yin par 'gyur gyi yul gzhan gsum po dag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni dung ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'on ni gzugs nyi tshe dung yin par 'gyur gyi yul gzhan gsum po dag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni dung ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: But if it were so, then only the form would be the conch, and it would be unreasonable for the four great elements of the other three objects not to be the conch.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar @174b dkar ba nyid mig nyi tshe'i yul yin pa ltar dung yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar @174b dkar ba nyid mig nyi tshe'i yul yin pa ltar dung yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: Moreover, just as whiteness is the object of the eye, it would be reasonable for the conch to be the same.

original: yang na ji ltar dkar ba de dngos po gzhan dag la khyab pa ltar dung yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dkar ba de dngos po gzhan dag la khyab pa ltar dung yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: Or, just as whiteness pervades other things, it would be reasonable for the conch to be the same.

original: dung ni de lta ma yin pas dkar ba nyid kyang de bzhin du dngos po dag la khyab par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dung ni de lta ma yin pas dkar ba nyid kyang de bzhin du dngos po dag la khyab par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the conch is not like that, whiteness also would not pervade things in the same way.

original: de lta bu'i don ni med pa'i phyir gcig ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don ni med pa'i phyir gcig ces byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since there is no such meaning, it is also unreasonable to say it is one.

original: gal te tha dad do zhe na de yang don du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te tha dad do zhe na de yang don du mi rung ste /
translated: If you say they are different, that is also unreasonable.

original: dkar ba nyid mthong ba na dung yin par shes pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: dkar ba nyid mthong ba na dung yin par shes pa'i rigs te /
translated: When whiteness is seen, it would be reasonable to know it is a conch,

original: bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different entities.

original: gzhan yang dkar ba nyid kyi gnas med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dkar ba nyid kyi gnas med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, whiteness would not exist as the locus of the universal of whiteness,

original: dung dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be related to the universal of whiteness.

original: ser po nyid gser dang / de bzhin du reg bya'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ser po nyid gser dang / de bzhin du reg bya'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The same would be true of yellowness and gold, and so on up to the tactile.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: dung gi dkar ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gser gyi ser po nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gser dang ser po nyid gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: dung gi dkar ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gser gyi ser po nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gser dang ser po nyid gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa'i dpe ste /
translated: Just as the whiteness of the conch is not different from the conch, the yellowness of gold is not different from gold. This is the second example, that of the identity and difference of gold and yellowness.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as in the previous example.

original: rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra'i snyan pa nyid kyang rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra dang / gcig pa dang tha dad pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra'i snyan pa nyid kyang rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rgyu'o rgyud mangs kyi sgra dang / gcig pa dang tha dad pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The pleasantness of the sound of the lute is not easily designated as either the same as or different from the sound of the lute. This is the third example, that of the sound of the lute and neither identity nor difference.

original: 'di ltar sgra dang snyan pa nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra dang snyan pa nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to say that sound and pleasantness are the same,

original: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the general and the particular are different.

original: de la sgra ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de la sgra ni spyi'o //
translated: In this regard, sound is the general,

original: snyan pa nyid bye brag go //
analyzed: snyan pa nyid bye brag go //
translated: and pleasantness is the particular.

original: yang na sgra dang snyan pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na sgra dang snyan pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because sound and pleasantness are not different.

original: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not possible to say that they are different,

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have a different nature.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na de las ni rgyu'o rgyud mangs dang sgra las gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par 'byed de mdo de dang sbyar na rgyu'o //üîΩrgyud mangs ni spyi'i yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na de las ni rgyu'o rgyud mangs dang sgra las gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par 'byed de mdo de dang sbyar na rgyu'o // rgyud mangs ni spyi'i yin te /
translated: If this is applied to the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it is said there that the general is the cause, the particular is the strings, and the sound is neither the same as nor different from them.

original: yul rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgra ni bye brag yin te /
analyzed: yul rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // sgra ni bye brag yin te /
translated: The strings are the general because they possess the five aspects of an object.

original: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is the particular because it is one part of that.

original: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang 'di dag don mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang 'di dag don mthun par bshad de /
translated: The Explanation of the Intention also explains these in a similar way.

original: de las ni pi wang dang / sgra zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩaa ka ru nag po'i dri zhim pa nyid kyang aa ka ru nag po de dang gcig pa'i @175a * //
analyzed: de las ni pi wang dang / sgra zhes 'byung ngo // aa ka ru nag po'i dri zhim pa nyid kyang aa ka ru nag po de dang gcig pa'i @175a * //
translated: and from that, the lute and the sound arise.üîΩThe sweet fragrance of black agarwood is not easily designated as having the characteristic of being the same as the black agarwood or as having the characteristic of being different from it.

original: mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa aa ka ru dang dri zhim pa gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa aa ka ru dang dri zhim pa gcig pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /

analyzed: aa ka ru dang dri zhim pa ni gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to say that the sweet fragrance of black agarwood is the same as black agarwood.

original: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the general and the particular are different.

original: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable to say that they are different.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have a different nature.üîΩThe hotness of long pepper is not easily designated as having the characteristic of being the same as long pepper or as having the characteristic of being different from it.

analyzed: na le sham gyi tsha ba nyid kyang na le sham de dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dam tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lnga pa na le sham dang tsha ba nyid gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma
translated: This is the fifth example of the hotness of long pepper not being the same as or different from long pepper.

original: yin pa'i dpe ste /

translated: The example of the ‚Äúis‚Äù is this.

analyzed: na le sham dang tsha ba nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /

original: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal and the particular are different.

analyzed: tha dad ces byar yang mi rung ste /

analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las pi pi ling dang tshab nyid ces 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it says, ‚ÄúBlack pepper and hotness.‚ÄùüîΩJust as with black pepper and hotness, so it is with the astringent taste of myrobalan.

analyzed: na le sham dang tsha ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du aa ru ra'i bska ba nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa aa ru ra dang bska ba gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste gong ma bzhin du rig par
translated: This is the sixth example, of myrobalan and astringent taste not being the same or different.üîΩUnderstand it as above.

analyzed: bya'o // dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma'i 'jam pa nyid kyang shing bal gyi 'dab ma dang gcig pa'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces gdags par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa shing bal dang 'jam pa nyid gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is the seventh example, that of cotton and softness, which are neither the same nor different.

analyzed: de la shing bal zhes bya ba ni rgyud de bshad pa las shu dag dang / lcang ma'i me tog la bya'o zhe'o //

analyzed: 'dab ma dang 'jam pa nyid gcig ces byar mi rung ste /
